net.rtccloud.sdk

Interface Call


  • public interface Call
    Represents a call. Such an object is created by the SDK on CreatedEvent.
    See Also:
    RtccEngine.createCall(String), RtccEngine#createCall(String, StartingOptions)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Size of a video feed

      Options used to start a Call

      Video profile
      static class  Call.VideoSource
      Hardware that captures Video

    • Method Detail

      • getCallId

        int getCallId()
        Returns:
        The ID of the call

      • getCallType

        Call.CallType getCallType()
        Returns:
        The type of call

      • hangup

        void hangup()
        Hang up the call and stop it. Fires a StatusEvent.
        getStatus() will be Call.CallStatus.ENDED.
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalStateException - if Call is already Call.CallStatus.ENDED

      • pause

        void pause()
        Pause the call so it can be later resumed.
        Fires a StatusEvent.
        getStatus() will be Call.CallStatus.PAUSED.

        WARNING: Not Yet Available !

      • resume

        void resume()
        See Also:
        resume(StartingOptions)

      • resume

        void resume(Call.StartingOptions options)
        Resume a Call.CallStatus.PAUSED call or pick up a Call.CallStatus.RINGING call, with the provided options.
        Fires a StatusEvent.
        A call to getStatus() will return Call.CallStatus.ACTIVE.
        Parameters:
        options - The options to apply
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalStateException - if Call is already Call.CallStatus.ACTIVE

      • videoStart

        void videoStart()
        Start sending video from the camera. The video starts automatically upon call start.
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalStateException - if video is already started

      • videoStop

        void videoStop()
        Stop sending video from the camera and stop the ScreenShare
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalArgumentException - if video is already stopped
        RtccIllegalStateException - if it's a WebRTC call or if it's already receiving screen share

      • screenShareStart

        void screenShareStart(View view)
        Start the screen sharing with the provided View
        Parameters:
        view - The view to share
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalArgumentException - if view is null

      • screenShareStop

        void screenShareStop()
        Stop the screen sharing
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalStateException - if it's a WebRTC call or if it's not sending screen share

      • audioStart

        void audioStart()
        Start sending audio from the microphone.
        This function starts the sending of captured audio packet.
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalStateException - if audio is already started

      • audioStop

        void audioStop()
        Stop sending audio from the microphone.
        The function stops the sending of captured audio packet. Silent audio frames are sent instead.
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalStateException - if audio is already stopped

      • setVideoSource

        void setVideoSource(Call.VideoSource source)
        Change the camera source
        Parameters:
        source - The new source to use
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalArgumentException - if source is null

      • setInVideoProfile

        void setInVideoProfile(Call.VideoProfile profile)
        Request an incoming video profile change.
        This will ask the other participant of the video call to toggle their video sending resolution between HD and SD.
        Parameters:
        profile - The new profile to use
        Throws:
        RtccIllegalArgumentException - if profile is null or if the Call is a conference

      • getStatus

        Call.CallStatus getStatus()
        The Status defines the lifecycle of the current call.

        This is the standard workflow in an emitting call :
        Call.CallStatus.PROCEEDING -> Call.CallStatus.ACTIVE -> [ Call.CallStatus.PAUSED -> Call.CallStatus.ACTIVE ]* -> Call.CallStatus.ENDED

        This is the standard workflow in a receiving call :
        Call.CallStatus.RINGING -> Call.CallStatus.ACTIVE -> [ Call.CallStatus.PAUSED -> Call.CallStatus.ACTIVE ]* -> Call.CallStatus.ENDED

        When a call is being created to call an invalid uid, it's status is, by default, Call.CallStatus.ENDED
        Returns:
        The status of the call.

      • getVideoInProfile

        Call.VideoProfile getVideoInProfile(int contactId)
        Parameters:
        contactId - The corresponding contact id
        Returns:
        The video profile for input video

        Returns:

      • setFlashEnabled

        boolean setFlashEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable the camera led flash.
        This will fail if your camera doesn't have led flash or if the corresponding camera isn't currently used.
        Parameters:
        enable -
        Returns:
        true if it succeeds, false otherwise

      • isFlashEnabled

        boolean isFlashEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if the flash is enabled, false otherwise

      • setAutoFocusEnabled

        boolean setAutoFocusEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable the camera auto-focus.
        This will fail if your camera doesn't support auto-focus or if the corresponding camera isn't currently used.
        Parameters:
        enable -
        Returns:
        true if it succeeds, false otherwise

        y - Y coordinate in percentage [0-1]

        Parameters:
